scripts.kill-ports: node -e "const { execSync } = require('child_process'); const ports = [3000, 5000, 5001]; let killed = []; try { ports.forEach(port => { try { const isWindows = process.platform === 'win32'; const findProcess = isWindows ? `netstat -ano | findstr :${port}` : `lsof -i :${port} | grep LISTEN`; const result = execSync(findProcess, { stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'ignore'] }).toString().trim(); if (result) { const pid = isWindows ? result.split(/\s+/).pop() : result.split(/\s+/).filter(Boolean)[1]; if (pid) { const killCmd = isWindows ? `taskkill /F /PID ${pid}` : `kill -9 ${pid}`; execSync(killCmd, { stdio: 'ignore' }); killed.push(`${port} (PID ${pid})`); } } } catch (e) {} }); console.log(killed.length ? `Killed: ${killed.join(', ')}` : 'No ports in use'); } catch (e) { console.log('No ports in use'); }"
scripts.start: npm run kill-ports && concurrently -n 'SERVER,CLIENT' -c 'bgBlue.bold,bgGreen.bold' "npm run server" "wait-on http://localhost:5000 && npm run client"
scripts.start:dev: npm run kill-ports && concurrently -n 'SERVER,CLIENT' -c 'bgBlue.bold,bgGreen.bold' "npm run server" "wait-on http://localhost:5000 && npm run dev"
